p: Note, however, that there are some differences between the two insurances in the kinds of information they need. After-the-fact insurance like that from the ARC needs to estimate both the existence of a contagious disease and the amount of harm it will do. However, the premium for an insurance against a vaccine’s chances of not being needed can be based solely on whether the disease it protects against breaks out and the (average) cost of R&D for a vaccine; it does not need precise data on the number of patients affected or at risk beyond establishing that there are “many.”
